title: The frustration when someone else on your team picks your main
body: And has no idea how to play them....

replies.body: And won't listen to suggestions.

> [{quoted}](name=Stars Shaper,realm=EUW,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=e1PmIwvi,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-12-15T11:13:17.326+0000)
>
> And won't listen to suggestions.

I main Diana. I watched someone playing her vs swain which is dianas hardest match up in my opinion I told them to build abysal first and they built morrelicon which is OK but they also would only poke with q and hope for the best but it never worked

I had an enemy playing Xerath who started with the support AP item while I was on Varus mid and proceeded to push him out of lane xD

Unfortunally for it my team was so dumb to never go on him and neither protecting me so in the end he got fed after being 0/3 in lane...
I cri evrytiem. {{item:3070}} {{champion:86}} {{item:3070}}
How can one have no idea how to play Garen
Exactly why I cry. T_T
How do you play garen? please help, i've never touched him and i'm curious...

> [{quoted}](name=TDubH,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=e1PmIwvi,comment-id=0003000000000000,timestamp=2015-12-15T16:51:57.720+0000)
>
> How do you play garen? please help, i've never touched him and i'm curious...

Allow me to enlighten you: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jTYX9R8ntfE

Joins a pre-5; they're doing all void champs.

"DO Kha'Zix jungle."
 - "I don't even own him."
"Just buy him - he's easy."
 - *{Buys kha'Zix and dies to every jungle camp during first clear.}*
"Dude, you suck."
- "I bought him at your request. Don't complain."

Not a quote - Is a true story.

It really is heart wrenching. The whole time I'm just thinking in my head "if you don't play this champ like he/she deserves I will smite you with the lords wrath" and then when they get rekt you gotta resist the urge to type "see should have let me go top". Because you know damn well you would have played that champion better. Gah.
I see Nasus lose to Riven and I die a little on the inside everytime
And then you press tab, and realize that its almost the easiest matchup possible for your champion.
And then you cry. Circle of life.

SP or AD?
AP can wreck Lee at lvl 3. Just gotta set up that ambush.

I don.t care if anyone picks them and is bad. i simply tell them I'm judging them and pick someone else.

P.S. same for the enemy, the judging is real.
*judging intensifies*
There's also that feeling of disappointment when he's better on your main than you are.
Rule 256 of denial in league: They're never better than you at your main, your team are just noobs that fed them.

only one situation is worst than this

2 mains of the same champ in a mirror match
That's the best possible situation!  True skill matchup

yeah, whats even better is when the enemy:
1. has a skin (and you dont for whatever reason)
2. is way higher ranked (I'm silver 5, and love facing plats in mirror matches)
3. starts with an overly aggressive item (so you know they want to win hard) {{item:1082}}

And then you completely humiliate them in lane and later in the game...

you're one of the few of enjoys mirror matches...
just hoping that new champ select makes the mirror match exclusive for one for all
{{champion:41}} The one guy who spaces his barrels about 3 inches apart and just leaves them there so the enemy can get an extra 5 gold
One of my friends mains gp and I just started making faces in lane with my barrels to piss him off.
That wouldn't piss me off, I would just laugh
I would ignore fights to throw barrels all over the place, the other team thought it was funnier than my team

{{champion:157}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:157}} frustration intensifies after they feed zed 7 kills in lane
Yasuo's just one of those champions who's always useless when he's on your team, but amazing on the other. Just like {{champion:35}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:67}} {{champion:432}}

{{champion:268}}  is my main......










It's been a hard life.
{{champion:266}} No one ever picks me, so I'm safe from this

when i see another {{champion:223}} 

EAT HIM. YOU CAN SAVE HIM YOU **** JUST EAT HIM. DO YOU NOT EVEN KNOW HOW TO PROC YOUR PASSIVE. YOUR Q WILL STUN THEM RIGHT NOW. I HAVE NOT SEEN YOU ULT ONE TIME

My feeling whenever I see a Malz player starting with visions instead of either his Q or W.

"Why, why, why would you do that? Start with Q or W so you can get your voidling! Vincent (I call the Voidling Vincent) demands to be on the battlefield!"

I main malz and i always start e? Your voidling wont attack the enemy unless their a vision on them so thats why i dont take q lvl 1. But i must add i only use my e on the enemy and not on minions level 1

I saw an annie build a {{item:3085}} ..

*shudder*

I had a {{champion:8}}  with AD runes so he could "Last hit easier". He then proceeded to stack armor vs an Irelia. I was so fucking frothing with rage because I had to deal with a fed Irelia AND he took the champion I was gonna use.
For personal reasons, how do you counterbuild/counter Irelia as Vlad? Even though he's my main I find her a really tough matchup to deal with if they're decent.

Rylai's is your best chance at not feeding or even killing her. The vast majority of her damage is on hit true damage, so she ignores your AR for the most part. Additionally Vlad has a passive revolving around building AP/HP. You can get Zhonya's but it's not going to help as much as it would vs other AD champions without the true damage. You want the HP, AP, and kiting that Rylai's gives. I would at least rush hextech revolver if not finish a Will of the Ancients, and then rush rylai's.
Yeah, that's what I thought. The problem is finishing WotA, Boots and Rylai's altogether without dying. Thanks though.
If you can perfect your Rylai's use and use scaling CDR glyphs you can destroy any bruiser as vlad tbh. With 40% cdr they can't touch you because they're permaslowed.

45% cdr Vlad is the dirtiest shit.  I use flat 10% CDR runes and get the other thirty from SV, WotA and Lucidity Boots, but thanks for all the advice.

...I mean...I know how to play Vlad...Honest...

But thank you.

Also be sure to freeze lane and harass. Irelia relies on constant AAing to sustain. If you free the lane she will either not heal off your harass and get pushed out of lane or risk death, or the wave will be even closer to your turret and safer.
To be fair if you're really bad at last hitting with mages flat AD runes aren't a bad option but i mean come on...mage last hitting doesnt get much easier than {{champion:8}}
That doesn't happen to me much. Usually it's someone on the enemy team picking one of my mains. I then go super ultra tryhard mode and dunk the shit out of them as much as I can.

Usually they just ban my main(s). 

Me: "Support, please."
_bans Bard_
Me: "Lol can I go mid then?"
_bans Vel'koz_
Me: "WHY!?"
It's even worse when you're playing something that isn't your main, and the enemy team picks your main, and you have to lane against them. And then you lose.

I don't main {{champion:157}} (although he is getting the job done for climbing out of Bronze) but I pick him every game he isn't banned because i'm tired of my teammates playing him without practice and making a fool of themselves in game
That feeling of absolute despair when you see a Bard take windspeakers, take E at level 1, and start coin.

Haven't had that problem in a long time
{{item:3070}} {{champion:30}}

I think I hate it more when someone picks your main and is a complete ass the whole match. It sucks when someone is bad with your main, but it's worse when they tarnish the good name of everyone who mains that champ.
